abstract: The Swiss drug maker said that it would pay Nestlé $11 billion for a 25 percent stake in Alcon, the world’s biggest eye-care company.
snippet: The Swiss drug maker said that it would pay Nestlé $11 billion for a 25 percent stake in Alcon, the world’s biggest eye-care company.
lead_paragraph: PARIS  The Swiss drug maker Novartis said on Monday that it would pay Nestlé $11 billion for a 25 percent stake in Alcon, the world’s biggest eye-care company, in the first step of a deal that could become a full acquisition.

headline.main: Novartis Buys Alcon Stake From Nestlé
